title: Series Index
text: searching extracting specific serie, see full workflow:
code: library(tidyBdE) library(tidyverse)  # GDP France fr <- bde_catalog_search("Francia(.*)PIB")  # Show table on vignette fr %>%   select(Numero_secuencial, Descripcion_de_la_serie) %>%   knitr::kable() # In this case we want to extract the first serie # See tidyverse style  fr %>%   # Select id   select(Numero_secuencial) %>%   # of first obs   slice(1) %>%   # convert to number   as.double() %>%   # And load it   bde_series_load() #> # A tibble: 116 × 2 #>    Date       `2563958` #>    <date>         <dbl> #>  1 1995-12-01      -5.1 #>  2 1996-03-01      NA   #>  3 1996-06-01      NA   #>  4 1996-09-01      NA   #>  5 1996-12-01      -3.9 #>  6 1997-03-01      NA   #>  7 1997-06-01      NA   #>  8 1997-09-01      NA   #>  9 1997-12-01      -3.6 #> 10 1998-03-01      NA   #> # ℹ 106 more rows  # See the metadata fr %>%   # Select id   select(Numero_secuencial) %>%   # of first obs   slice(1) %>%   # convert to number   as.double() %>%   # And load the metadata   bde_series_load(extract_metadata = TRUE) %>%   # To table on the vignette   knitr::kable()

title: Get Started with tidyBdE
text: Banco de España (BdE) provides several time-series, either produced institution compiled another sources, Eurostat INE. basic entry point searching time-series catalogs (indexes) information. can search series name: Note BdE files provided Spanish, time , organism working English version. now, search terms provided Spanish order get search results. found series, can load series GBP/EUR exchange rate using sequential number reference (Numero_Secuencial) :
code: library(tidyBdE)  library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) library(tidyr)   # Search GBP on "TC" (exchange rate) catalog XR_GBP <- bde_catalog_search("GBP", catalog = "TC")  XR_GBP %>%   select(Numero_secuencial, Descripcion_de_la_serie) %>%   # To table on document   knitr::kable() seq_number <- XR_GBP %>%   # First record   slice(1) %>%   # Get id   select(Numero_secuencial) %>%   # Convert to num   as.double()   seq_number #> [1] 573214   time_series <- bde_series_load(seq_number, series_label = "EUR_GBP_XR") %>%   filter(Date >= "2010-01-01" & Date <= "2020-12-31") %>%   drop_na()

title: Get Started with tidyBdE
text: package also provides custom ggplot2 theme based publications BdE: EUR/GBP Exchange Rate (2010-2020) package provides also several “shortcut” functions selection relevant macroeconomic series, need look advance: Spanish Economic Indicators (2010-2019)
code: ggplot(time_series, aes(x = Date, y = EUR_GBP_XR)) +   geom_line(colour = bde_tidy_palettes(n = 1)) +   geom_smooth(method = "gam", colour = bde_tidy_palettes(n = 2)[2]) +   labs(     title = "EUR/GBP Exchange Rate (2010-2020)",     subtitle = "%",     caption = "Source: BdE"   ) +   geom_vline(     xintercept = as.Date("2016-06-23"),     linetype = "dotted"   ) +   geom_label(aes(     x = as.Date("2016-06-23"),     y = .95,     label = "Brexit"   )) +   coord_cartesian(ylim = c(0.7, 1)) +   theme_tidybde() # Data in "long" format  plotseries <- bde_ind_gdp_var("GDP YoY", out_format = "long") %>%   bind_rows(     bde_ind_unemployment_rate("Unemployment Rate", out_format = "long")   ) %>%   drop_na() %>%   filter(Date >= "2010-01-01" & Date <= "2019-12-31")  ggplot(plotseries, aes(x = Date, y = serie_value)) +   geom_line(aes(color = serie_name), linewidth = 1) +   labs(     title = "Spanish Economic Indicators (2010-2019)",     subtitle = "%",     caption = "Source: BdE"   ) +   theme_tidybde() +   scale_color_bde_d(palette = "bde_vivid_pal") # Custom palette on the package

title: Get Started with tidyBdE
text: can use tidyBdE create local repository given local directory passing following option: option set, tidyBdE look cached file bde_cache_dir directory load , speeding process. possible update data (.e. every monthly quarterly data release) following commands:
code: options(bde_cache_dir = "./path/to/location") bde_catalog_update()  # On most of the functions using the option update_cache = TRUE  bde_series_load("SOME ID", update_cache = TRUE)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Diego H. Herrero. Author, maintainer, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: H. Herrero D (2025). tidyBdE: Download Data Bank Spain. doi:10.32614/CRAN.package.tidyBdE, https://ropenspain.github.io/tidyBdE/.
code: @Manual{R-tidyBdE,   title = {{tidyBdE}: Download Data from Bank of Spain},   doi = {10.32614/CRAN.package.tidyBdE},   author = {Diego {H. Herrero}},   year = {2025},   version = {0.3.8},   url = {https://ropenspain.github.io/tidyBdE/},   abstract = {Tools to download data series from Banco de España (BdE) on tibble format. Banco de España is the national central bank and, within the framework of the Single Supervisory Mechanism (SSM), the supervisor of the Spanish banking system along with the European Central Bank. This package is in no way sponsored endorsed or administered by Banco de España.}, }

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Small typos grammatical errors documentation may edited directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. YES ✔️: edit roxygen comment .R file R/. ❌: edit .Rd file man/.

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: make substantial pull request, always file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s problem. ’ve found bug, create associated issue illustrate bug minimal reprex.

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: recommend create Git branch pull request (PR). Look R-CMD-check build status . making changes, run devtools::check() ensure new Notes, Warnings Errors appearing. recommend tidyverse style guide. also use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2. use testthat. Contributions test cases included easier accept. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md current development version header describing changes made followed GitHub username, links relevant issue(s)/PR(s).

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Email person listed maintainer DESCRIPTION file repo. Though note private discussions email don’t help others - course email totally warranted ’s sensitive problem kind.

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: contributing guide adapted tidyverse contributing guide available https://raw.githubusercontent.com/r-lib/usethis/master/inst/templates/tidy-contributing.md

what: Download Data from Bank of Spain
title: Download Data from Bank of Spain
text: tidyBdE API package helps retrieve data Banco de España. data returned tibble package tries guess format every time-series (dates, characters numbers).

title: Download Data from Bank of Spain
text: Install tidyBdE CRAN: can install developing version tidyBdE : Alternatively, can install developing version tidyBdE using r-universe:
code: install.packages("tidyBdE") remotes::install_github("ropenspain/tidyBdE") # Install tidyBdE in R: install.packages("tidyBdE", repos = c(   "https://ropenspain.r-universe.dev",   "https://cloud.r-project.org" ))

title: Download Data from Bank of Spain
text: Banco de España (BdE) provides several time-series, either produced institution compiled another sources, Eurostat INE. basic entry point searching time-series catalogs (indexes) information. can search series name: Note BdE files provided Spanish, time , organism working English version. now, search terms provided Spanish order get search results. found series, can load series GBP/EUR exchange rate using sequential number reference (Numero_Secuencial) :
code: library(tidyBdE)  # Load tidyverse for better handling library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) library(tidyr)   # Search GBP on "TC" (exchange rate) catalog XR_GBP <- bde_catalog_search("GBP", catalog = "TC")  XR_GBP %>%   select(Numero_secuencial, Descripcion_de_la_serie) %>%   # To table on document   knitr::kable() seq_number <- XR_GBP %>%   # First record   slice(1) %>%   # Get id   select(Numero_secuencial) %>%   # Convert to num   as.double()  # Extract series time_series <- bde_series_load(seq_number, series_label = "EUR_GBP_XR") %>%   filter(Date >= "2010-01-01" & Date <= "2020-12-31") %>%   drop_na()

title: Download Data from Bank of Spain
text: package also provides custom ggplot2 theme based publications BdE:  package provides also several “shortcut” functions selection relevant macroeconomic series, need look advance:
code: ggplot(time_series, aes(x = Date, y = EUR_GBP_XR)) +   geom_line(colour = bde_tidy_palettes(n = 1)) +   geom_smooth(method = "gam", colour = bde_tidy_palettes(n = 2)[2]) +   labs(     title = "EUR/GBP Exchange Rate (2010-2020)",     subtitle = "%",     caption = "Source: BdE"   ) +   geom_vline(     xintercept = as.Date("2016-06-23"),     linetype = "dotted"   ) +   geom_label(aes(     x = as.Date("2016-06-23"),     y = .95,     label = "Brexit"   )) +   coord_cartesian(ylim = c(0.7, 1)) +   theme_tidybde() # Data in "long" format  plotseries <- bde_ind_gdp_var("GDP YoY", out_format = "long") %>%   bind_rows(     bde_ind_unemployment_rate("Unemployment Rate", out_format = "long")   ) %>%   drop_na() %>%   filter(Date >= "2010-01-01" & Date <= "2019-12-31")  ggplot(plotseries, aes(x = Date, y = serie_value)) +   geom_line(aes(color = serie_name), linewidth = 1) +   labs(     title = "Spanish Economic Indicators (2010-2019)",     subtitle = "%",     caption = "Source: BdE"   ) +   theme_tidybde() +   scale_color_bde_d(palette = "bde_vivid_pal") # Custom palette on the package

title: Download Data from Bank of Spain
text: Two custom palettes, based used BdE publications available. palettes can applied ggplot2 using custom utils included package (see help("scale_color_bde_d", package = "tidyBdE")).

title: Download Data from Bank of Spain
text: can use tidyBdE create local repository given local directory passing following option: option set, tidyBdE look cached file bde_cache_dir directory load , speeding process. possible update data (.e. every monthly quarterly data release) following commands:
code: options(bde_cache_dir = "./path/to/location") bde_catalog_update()  # On most of the functions using the option update_cache = TRUE  bde_series_load("SOME ID", update_cache = TRUE)

title: Load BdE catalogs — bde_catalog_load
text: Load time-series catalogs provided BdE.

title: Load BdE catalogs — bde_catalog_load
code: bde_catalog_load(   catalog = c("ALL", "BE", "SI", "TC", "TI", "PB"),   parse_dates = TRUE,   cache_dir = NULL,   update_cache = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Load BdE catalogs — bde_catalog_load
text: Time-series bulk data download.

title: Load BdE catalogs — bde_catalog_load
text: catalog single value indicating catalogs updated "" shorthand. See Details. parse_dates Logical. TRUE dates parsed using bde_parse_dates(). cache_dir path cache directory. directory can also set via options options(bde_cache_dir = "path//dir"). update_cache Logical. TRUE requested file updated cache_dir. verbose Logical TRUE FALSE, display information useful debugging.

title: Load BdE catalogs — bde_catalog_load

title: Parse dates — bde_parse_dates
text: function tailored date formatting used package, may fail used another datasets. See Examples checking formats considered.

title: Parse dates — bde_parse_dates
text: dates_to_parse Dates parse

title: Parse dates — bde_parse_dates
text: Date object.

title: Parse dates — bde_parse_dates
text: Tries parse strings representing dates using .Date()

title: Parse dates — bde_parse_dates
code: # Formats parsed would_parse <- c(   "02 FEB2019", "15 ABR 1890", "MAR 2020", "ENE2020",   "2020", "12-1993", "01-02-2014", "01/02/1990" )  parsed_ok <- bde_parse_dates(would_parse)  class(parsed_ok) #> [1] "Date"  tibble::tibble(raw = would_parse, parsed = parsed_ok) #> # A tibble: 8 × 2 #>   raw         parsed     #>   <chr>       <date>     #> 1 02 FEB2019  2019-02-02 #> 2 15 ABR 1890 1890-04-15 #> 3 MAR 2020    2020-03-01 #> 4 ENE2020     2020-01-01 #> 5 2020        2020-12-31 #> 6 12-1993     1993-12-01 #> 7 01-02-2014  2014-02-01 #> 8 01/02/1990  1990-02-01  #-----------------------------------  # Formats not admitted wont_parse <- c("JAN2001", "2010-01-12", "01 APR 2017", "01/31/1990")  parsed_fail <- bde_parse_dates(wont_parse)  class(parsed_fail) #> [1] "Date"  tibble::tibble(raw = wont_parse, parsed = parsed_fail) #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   raw         parsed     #>   <chr>       <date>     #> 1 JAN2001     NA         #> 2 2010-01-12  0112-10-20 #> 3 01 APR 2017 NA         #> 4 01/31/1990  NA

text: series name positional code showing location table. example, table be_6_1 represents Table 1, Chapter 6 Statistical Bulletin (""). Although unique value, subject change (.e. new table inserted ). reason, function bde_series_load() suitable extracting specific time-series.

Opera… Tipo de… Tipo de… Tipo de… #> 5 DESCRIPCIÓN DE LAS UNIDADES Porcentaje              Porcent… Porcent… Porcent… #> 6 FRECUENCIA                  LABORABLE               LABORAB… LABORAB… LABORAB…  # Data bde_series_full_load("TI_1_1.csv") #> # A tibble: 6,835 × 5 #>    Date       TI_1_1.1 TI_1_1.2 TI_1_1.3 TI_1_1.4 #>    <date>        <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> #>  1 1999-01-01        3       NA     4.5      2    #>  2 1999-01-04        3       NA     3.25     2.75 #>  3 1999-01-05        3       NA     3.25     2.75 #>  4 1999-01-06        3       NA     3.25     2.75 #>  5 1999-01-07        3       NA     3.25     2.75 #>  6 1999-01-08        3       NA     3.25     2.75 #>  7 1999-01-11        3       NA     3.25     2.75 #>  8 1999-01-12        3       NA     3.25     2.75 #>  9 1999-01-13        3       NA     3.25     2.75 #> 10 1999-01-14        3       NA     3.25     2.75 #> # ℹ 6,825 more rows # }

what: Load a single BdE time-series — bde_series_load
title: Load a single BdE time-series — bde_series_load
text: series alias positional code showing location (column /row) series table. However, although unique, good candidate used series ID, subject change. series changes position table, alias also change. ensure series can still identified, even changes, assigned sequential number (series_code function) remain unchanged throughout series' lifetime. Note single series used different tables, can several aliases. need search alias recommended use bde_series_full_load().

title: Load a single BdE time-series — bde_series_load
code: bde_series_load(   series_code,   series_label = NULL,   out_format = "wide",   parse_dates = TRUE,   parse_numeric = TRUE,   cache_dir = NULL,   update_cache = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE,   extract_metadata = FALSE )

title: Load a single BdE time-series — bde_series_load
text: series_code numeric (coercible base::.double() value vector time-series code(s), defined field Número secuencial corresponding series. See bde_catalog_load(). series_label Optional. Character vector value. Allows specify custom label series extracted. length series_code. out_format Defines format must returned "long" dataset "wide" dataset. Possible values "wide" "long". See Value Details Section Examples. parse_dates Logical. TRUE dates parsed using bde_parse_dates(). parse_numeric Logical. TRUE columns parsed double (numeric) values. See Note. cache_dir path cache directory. directory can also set via options options(bde_cache_dir = "path//dir"). update_cache Logical. TRUE requested file updated cache_dir. verbose Logical TRUE FALSE, display information useful debugging. extract_metadata Logical TRUE/FALSE. TRUE output metadata requested series.

title: Load a single BdE time-series — bde_series_load
text: tibble field Date : out_format = "wide" series presented separate column name defined series_label. out_format = "long" tibble two columns, serie_name labels series serie_value value series. "wide" format suitable exporting .csv file "long" format suitable producing plots ggplot2::ggplot(). See also tidyr::pivot_longer() tidyr::pivot_wider().

title: Load a single BdE time-series — bde_series_load
text: Load single time-series provided BdE.

code: # \donttest{ # Metadata bde_series_load(573234, verbose = TRUE, extract_metadata = TRUE) #> tidyBdE> Caching on temporary directory C:\Users\RUNNER~1\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpeML2eX #> tidyBdE> Cached version of BE detected #> tidyBdE> Cached version of SI detected #> tidyBdE> Cached version of TC detected #> tidyBdE> Cached version of TI detected #> tidyBdE> Cached version of PB detected #> tidyBdE> Parsing dates #> tidyBdE> Extracting series 573234 #>  #> tidyBdE> Downloading serie 573234 from file TC_1_1.csv (alias TC_1_1.1). #> tidyBdE> Caching on temporary directory C:\Users\RUNNER~1\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpeML2eX/TC #> tidyBdE> Downloading file from https://www.bde.es/webbe/es/estadisticas/compartido/datos/csv/tc_1_1.csv #>  #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   Date                        `573234`                                           #>   <chr>                       <chr>                                              #> 1 NOMBRE DE LA SERIE          DTCCBCEUSDEUR.B                                    #> 2 NÚMERO SECUENCIAL           573234                                             #> 3 ALIAS DE LA SERIE           TC_1_1.1                                           #> 4 DESCRIPCIÓN DE LA SERIE     Tipo de cambio. Dólares estadounidenses por euro … #> 5 DESCRIPCIÓN DE LAS UNIDADES Dólares de Estados Unidos por Euro                 #> 6 FRECUENCIA                  LABORABLE                                           # Data bde_series_load(573234, extract_metadata = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 6,834 × 2 #>    Date       `573234` #>    <date>        <dbl> #>  1 1999-01-04     1.18 #>  2 1999-01-05     1.18 #>  3 1999-01-06     1.17 #>  4 1999-01-07     1.16 #>  5 1999-01-08     1.17 #>  6 1999-01-11     1.16 #>  7 1999-01-12     1.15 #>  8 1999-01-13     1.17 #>  9 1999-01-14     1.17 #> 10 1999-01-15     1.16 #> # ℹ 6,824 more rows  # Vectorized bde_series_load(c(573234, 573214),   series_label = c("US/EUR", "GBP/EUR"),   extract_metadata = TRUE ) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   Date                        `US/EUR`                                 `GBP/EUR` #>   <chr>                       <chr>                                    <chr>     #> 1 NOMBRE DE LA SERIE          DTCCBCEUSDEUR.B                          DTCCBCEG… #> 2 NÚMERO SECUENCIAL           573234                                   573214    #> 3 ALIAS DE LA SERIE           TC_1_1.1                                 TC_1_1.4  #> 4 DESCRIPCIÓN DE LA SERIE     Tipo de cambio. Dólares estadounidenses… Tipo de … #> 5 DESCRIPCIÓN DE LAS UNIDADES Dólares de Estados Unidos por Euro       Libras e… #> 6 FRECUENCIA                  LABORABLE                                LABORABLE  wide <- bde_series_load(c(573234, 573214),   series_label = c("US/EUR", "GBP/EUR") )  # Wide format wide #> # A tibble: 6,834 × 3 #>    Date       `US/EUR` `GBP/EUR` #>    <date>        <dbl>     <dbl> #>  1 1999-01-04     1.18     0.711 #>  2 1999-01-05     1.18     0.712 #>  3 1999-01-06     1.17     0.708 #>  4 1999-01-07     1.16     0.706 #>  5 1999-01-08     1.17     0.709 #>  6 1999-01-11     1.16     0.704 #>  7 1999-01-12     1.15     0.707 #>  8 1999-01-13     1.17     0.708 #>  9 1999-01-14     1.17     0.706 #> 10 1999-01-15     1.16     0.704 #> # ℹ 6,824 more rows   # Long format long <- bde_series_load(c(573234, 573214),   series_label = c("US/EUR", "GBP/EUR"),   out_format = "long" )  long #> # A tibble: 13,668 × 3 #>    Date       serie_name serie_value #>    <date>     <fct>            <dbl> #>  1 1999-01-04 US/EUR            1.18 #>  2 1999-01-05 US/EUR            1.18 #>  3 1999-01-06 US/EUR            1.17 #>  4 1999-01-07 US/EUR            1.16 #>  5 1999-01-08 US/EUR            1.17 #>  6 1999-01-11 US/EUR            1.16 #>  7 1999-01-12 US/EUR            1.15 #>  8 1999-01-13 US/EUR            1.17 #>  9 1999-01-14 US/EUR            1.17 #> 10 1999-01-15 US/EUR            1.16 #> # ℹ 13,658 more rows   # Use with ggplot library(ggplot2)   ggplot(long, aes(Date, serie_value)) +   geom_line(aes(group = serie_name, color = serie_name)) +   scale_color_bde_d() +   theme_tidybde()  # }

title: BdE color palettes — bde_tidy_palettes
text: Custom palettes based publications BdE. manual palettes maximum 6 colors.

title: BdE color palettes — bde_tidy_palettes
code: bde_tidy_palettes(   n = 6,   palette = c("bde_vivid_pal", "bde_rose_pal", "bde_qual_pal"),   alpha = NULL,   rev = FALSE )

title: BdE color palettes — bde_tidy_palettes
text: n number colors (>= 1) palette. palette valid palette name. alpha alpha-transparency level range [0,1] (0 means transparent 1 means opaque). missing, .e., alpha = NULL, add opacity codes ("FF") individual color hex codes. See ggplot2::alpha(). rev Logical indicating whether ordering colors reversed.

title: BdE color palettes — bde_tidy_palettes
text: vector colors.

title: BdE color palettes — bde_tidy_palettes
code: # BdE vivid pal scales::show_col(bde_tidy_palettes(palette = "bde_vivid_pal"),   labels = FALSE )   # BdE rose pal scales::show_col(bde_tidy_palettes(palette = "bde_rose_pal"), labels = FALSE)   # BdE qual pal scales::show_col(bde_tidy_palettes(palette = "bde_qual_pal"), labels = FALSE)

title: BdE scales for ggplot2 — scales_bde
text: Scales used ggplot2 package. Discrete palettes named scale_*_bde_d continuous palettes named scale_*_bde_c.

title: BdE scales for ggplot2 — scales_bde
code: scale_color_bde_d(   palette = c("bde_vivid_pal", "bde_rose_pal", "bde_qual_pal"),   alpha = NULL,   rev = FALSE,   ... )  scale_fill_bde_d(   palette = c("bde_vivid_pal", "bde_rose_pal", "bde_qual_pal"),   alpha = NULL,   rev = FALSE,   ... )  scale_color_bde_c(   palette = c("bde_rose_pal", "bde_vivid_pal", "bde_qual_pal"),   alpha = NULL,   rev = FALSE,   guide = "colorbar",   ... )  scale_fill_bde_c(   palette = c("bde_rose_pal", "bde_vivid_pal", "bde_qual_pal"),   alpha = NULL,   rev = FALSE,   guide = "colorbar",   ... )

title: BdE scales for ggplot2 — scales_bde
text: palette Name BdE palette apply. See bde_tidy_palettes() details. alpha alpha-transparency level range [0,1] (0 means transparent 1 means opaque). missing, .e., alpha = NULL, add opacity codes ("FF") individual color hex codes. See ggplot2::alpha(). rev Logical indicating whether ordering colors reversed. ... arguments ggplot2::discrete_scale() ggplot2::continuous_scale(). guide function used create guide name. See guides() information.

title: BdE scales for ggplot2 — scales_bde
text: ggplot2 color scale.

title: BdE scales for ggplot2 — scales_bde
code: library(ggplot2)  set.seed(596) txsamp <- subset(   txhousing,   city %in% c(     "Houston", "Fort Worth",     "San Antonio", "Dallas", "Austin"   ) )  ggplot(txsamp, aes(x = sales, y = median)) +   geom_point(aes(colour = city)) +   scale_color_bde_d() +   theme_minimal()    ggplot(txsamp, aes(x = sales, y = median)) +   geom_point(aes(colour = city)) +   scale_color_bde_d("bde_qual_pal") +   theme_minimal()

title: BdE ggplot2 theme — theme_tidybde
text: custom ggplot2 theme based publications BdE.

title: BdE ggplot2 theme — theme_tidybde
code: theme_tidybde(...)

title: BdE ggplot2 theme — theme_tidybde
text: ... Arguments passed ggplot2::theme_classic base_size base font size, given pts. base_family base font family base_line_size base size line elements base_rect_size base size rect elements

title: BdE ggplot2 theme — theme_tidybde
text: ggplot2 theme().

title: BdE ggplot2 theme — theme_tidybde
text: Theme based ggplot2::theme_classic().

title: BdE ggplot2 theme — theme_tidybde
code: # \donttest{ library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(tidyr)  series_TC <- bde_series_full_load("TC_1_1.csv")  # If download was OK then plot if (nrow(series_TC) > 0) {   series_TC <- series_TC[c(1, 2)]    series_TC_pivot <- series_TC %>%     filter(       Date >= "2020-01-01" & Date <= "2020-12-31",       !is.na(series_TC[[2]])     )    names(series_TC_pivot) <- c("x", "y")    ggplot(series_TC_pivot, aes(x = x, y = y)) +     geom_line(linewidth = 0.8, color = bde_tidy_palettes(n = 1)) +     labs(       title = "Title",       subtitle = "Some metric",       caption = "Bank of Spain"     ) +     theme_tidybde() }  # }

what: tidyBdE: Download Data from Bank of Spain — tidyBdE-package
title: tidyBdE: Download Data from Bank of Spain — tidyBdE-package
text: Tools download data series 'Banco de España' ('BdE') 'tibble' format. 'Banco de España' national central bank , within framework Single Supervisory Mechanism ('SSM'), supervisor Spanish banking system along European Central Bank. package way sponsored endorsed administered 'Banco de España'.

title: tidyBdE: Download Data from Bank of Spain — tidyBdE-package
text: Maintainer: Diego H. Herrero dev.dieghernan@gmail.com (ORCID) [copyright holder]

title: tidyBdE 0.3.8
text: CRAN release: 2024-12-20 Update bde_ind_gdp_quarterly() since underlying identifier changed.

title: tidyBdE 0.3.7
text: CRAN release: 2024-08-26 Update bde_ind_unemployment_rate() bde_ind_population() since underlying identifier changed. DOI changed CRAN url: https://doi.org/10.32614/CRAN.package.tidyBdE. Native encoding reading .csv files changed "latin1".

title: tidyBdE 0.3.6
text: CRAN release: 2024-04-22 Adapt scale_color_bde_d() friends ggplot2 3.5.0. Also expose guide argument instead hard-coding .

title: tidyBdE 0.3.5
text: CRAN release: 2024-01-29 Mostly changes color functions: bde_vivid_pal() bde_rose_pal() superseded. Use new function bde_tidy_palettes() instead. scale_color_bde_d() friends leverage now bde_tidy_palettes(), functions gain two new arguments: alpha y rev. Update review documentation. New palette named bde_qual_pal.

title: tidyBdE 0.3.4
text: CRAN release: 2023-06-13 Update API entry points.

title: tidyBdE 0.3.3
text: CRAN release: 2023-05-25 Update tests documentation.

title: tidyBdE 0.3.2
text: CRAN release: 2023-04-01 Remove tidyverse Suggests. bde_ind_ibex() renamed bde_ind_ibex_monthly(). New indicator bde_ind_ibex_daily()

title: tidyBdE 0.3.1
text: CRAN release: 2022-11-16 Add new dependency: tidyr. New parameter out_format bde_series_load(). Use best practices small adjustments theme_tidybde().

title: tidyBdE 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-10-07 url reachable, remove local csv since empty. Improve download process. informative messages final user. Internal performance improvements. Breaking change: theme_bde() renamed theme_tidybde().

title: tidyBdE 0.2.5
text: CRAN release: 2022-08-13 Update HTML5 due CRAN request

title: tidyBdE 0.2.4
text: CRAN release: 2022-02-23 Update series code bde_ind_cpi_var().

title: tidyBdE 0.2.3
text: CRAN release: 2022-01-19 CF: Financial Accounts Spanish Economy. IE: Economic Indicators

title: tidyBdE 0.2.2
text: CRAN release: 2021-10-29 bde_ind_euribor_12m_monthly(): New series code 587853. Update docs examples.

title: tidyBdE 0.2.1
text: CRAN release: 2021-10-07 Update docs vignettes. bde_series_load() now tries coerce characters numeric. Improve messages inconsistencies catalog series. Export bde_check_access().

title: tidyBdE 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-08-04 Add series index article. Add new series: bde_ind_gdp_quarterly(), bde_ind_population(). Improve package coverage docs. Move tests testthat. following scales removed: bde_scale_colour_vivid(), bde_scale_color_vivid(), bde_scale_fill_vivid(), bde_scale_colour_rose(), bde_scale_color_rose() bde_scale_fill_rose(). Use scale_color_bde_c() instead.

title: tidyBdE 0.1.2
text: CRAN release: 2021-07-07 Precompile vignette. Better handling errors, according CRAN rules. Changed examples.

title: tidyBdE 0.1.1
text: CRAN release: 2021-06-05 Add vignette package Color adjustment bde_rose_pal(): Now hcl spectrum consistent roses blues according colorspace::specplot(). Add DOI: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4673496 New palettes ggplot2: scale_color_bde_c(), scale_color_bde_d(), scale_fill_bde_c(), scale_fill_bde_d(). Deprecated scales: bde_scale_colour_vivid(), bde_scale_color_vivid(), bde_scale_fill_vivid(), bde_scale_colour_rose(), bde_scale_color_rose() bde_scale_fill_rose().

title: tidyBdE 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-04-08 Initial release.
